meanings.definition: To remove a snag or obstacle from
meanings.sent1: She was unsnagging her sweater from the thorny bush.
meanings.sent2: He unsnagged the fishing line from the underwater log.
meanings.sent3: The cat unsnagged its claw from the curtain with a playful swipe.
meanings.sent4: The mechanic unsnagged the jammed gears in the old engine.
meanings.sent5: With a steady hand, she unsnagged the kite from the tree branches.

meanings.definition: The act of freeing something from a snag or obstruction
meanings.sent1: The unsnagging of the stuck zipper was a relief.
meanings.sent2: He performed the unsnagging of the tangled fishing net with skill.
meanings.sent3: The unsnagging of the kite from the tree was a comical sight.
meanings.sent4: The unsnagging of traffic after the accident took hours.
meanings.sent5: The unsnagging of the stuck door required a lot of effort.
